SENT.plain: One of the serious complications of Paget's disease (PD) is a significant increase in the risk of developing osteosarcoma
Approximately 1% of the patients with PD develop osteosarcoma
This contributes significantly to the mortality and morbidity of the patients with PD
We present the case of an elderly person, who developed osteosarcoma 1 year after being diagnosed to have PD
The patient had been diagnosed to have lymphoma 8 years prior to the diagnosis of PD
The association between PD and follicular lymphoma is discussed
